comments.body:
The key logic that marks a pod unschedulable is:

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/96f5e603081be4c4cd46f1fc7267eb3be6d4072a/pkg/scheduler/framework/plugins/nodevolumelimits/non_csi.go#L258-L260

- a new Node will possibly make the above criteria satisfied, so NodeAdd should be registered
- `numExistingVolumes` may decrease when some Pod (carrying volumes) get deleted, and hence may make the above criteria satisfied, so PodDelete should be registered
- Regarding PodUpdate, I'm not 100% sure if a Pod carrying volumes can be updated with fewer volumes (if the answer is yes, PodUpdate should also be registered; otherwise no)
- Regarding CSINode / PV / PVC / SC events, I don't think it's related
